images.caption: Synura ranks among golden algae with silicaceous scales. The cells are covered with scales which overlap like roof tiles. It is a colonial flagellate occurring in acid, clean waters. Golden coloration is caused by an accessory pigment flucoxanthin. Photo: Prof. Aloisie Poulíčková
Individually living flagellate with silicaceous scales, which are terminated by a prickle, the individual thus looks „hairy“ on the surface. Photo: Prof. Aloisie Poulíčková

Golden algae of the genus Dinobryon are flagellates, living in chitin cup-shaped cases, which form bush-like colonies. At the end of the season, vegetative individuals unite and form cysts. This type of primitive sexual reproduction is called hologamy. Photo: Prof. Aloisie Poulíčková

At the end of the season, vegetative individuals unite and form a cyst. This type of primitive sexual reproduction is called hologamy. The cyst is bottle-shaped and is reinforced with silica. The neck is closed with an organic plug. Photo: Prof. Aloisie Poulíčková
